byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and JESS BIDGOOD

abstract: Pennsylvania Atty Gen Kathleen G Kane announces her resignation after jury convicts her on nine criminal charges, including perjury and conspiracy; conviction is unlikely to end scandal, though, as investigators continue to comb through millions of emails from Kane's predecessor's staff, which came up during her trial.
lead_paragraph: Kathleen G. Kane, once one of the state’s most promising politicians, said she would resign after being convicted of perjury, conspiracy and other charges.
snippet: Kathleen G. Kane, once one of the state’s most promising politicians, said she would resign after being convicted of perjury, conspiracy and other charges....

headline.main: Pennsylvania Attorney General Quits on Heels of Perjury Conviction
headline.print_headline: Attorney General’s Conviction Unlikely to End Scandal in Pennsylvania
